            MANAGEMENT PROJECT,TF034000-VIETNAM - EDUCATION,TF034120-VIETNAM - CHILD NUTRITION AND

            MANAGEMENT PROJECT,TF055807-PHRD-MOLDOVA: SOCIAL PROTECTION
            MANAGEMENT PROJECT

abstracts.cdata!:
The overall outcome of the satisfactory;
            the performance of the Bank is satisfactory; and the
            performance of the borrowwer is moderately satisfactory. The
            objective of the Social Projection Management Project was to
            develop the capacity required to implement the pension
            reform and to support the development of an efficient and
            sustainable social protection system in Moldova. The project
            major changes include: (i) increase of contributions to the
            National Social Insurance House (NSIH); (ii) on time payment
            of pensions; (iii) transparent budgeting and accounting
            practice of the NSIH; (iv) improved management of the NSIH;
            (v) efficient information support through improved IT
            system; (v) strengthened social protection policy support;
            and (vi) increased awareness of the public regarding the
            pension system. Some lessons learned included: Improving the
            awareness of the general public about their rights and
            responsibilities in the pension system. The roles of the
            Communication Unit (CU) and the NSIH in pension information
            dissemination during this operation were crucial toward
            meeting the project development objective; implementation of
            similar projects requires improving the capacity of the
            implementing agencies to analyze social protection policy
            issues; it is essential to maintain commitment to pension
            policy reform. Implementation of a similar operation on
            pensions and social protection will require a better
            understanding of the institutional environment in which the
            project is to be implemented; strong reliance on sound
            analytical basis for designing effective operations in
            social protection is important. This operation was
            underpinned by the Bank's Economic Sector Work (ESW)
            and intensive dialogue with the Borrower, which contributed
            to a better understanding of social protection issues in Moldova.
